frameDefinitions: The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action .
This frame describes means actions (Preparatory_acts) that are taken by an Agent for the purpose of preparing for a later act.
This frame contains LUs which are like those of the Desirability frame except the Evaluee incorporates the Parameter as 'associated with a percieved place in a social heirarchy' for all LUs.
This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Duty needs to be fulfilled by a  Responsible_party.
In this frame an Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the Action affects the Affected_party.
frameExamples: The underwater sequences <t>warrant</t> the price of the admission alone.
This update lays the <t>groundwork</t> for future improvements.
His manner of dress was <t>pedestrian</t> but tidy.
It would <t>behoove</t> us to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples
Smithers was being very <t>fair</t> about the distribution of supplies.
listRoleDefinitions: An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for taking another <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that is taken to be justifiable given the <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> to acheive a <fen>Purpose</fen>.
The action performed by the Agent that is a preliminary to the achievement of the <fen>Purpose</fen>. The <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> may also be expressed by a result of such an act.
The ultimate goal or purpose of the <fen>Agent</fen>, which the Preparatory_act enables.
The part of the larger process that is preliminary to the achievement of the <fen>Purpose</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> takes place.
The place where the <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The time interval during which the <fen>Duty</fen> is mandatory.
A location in which the <fen>Duty</fen>  obtains.
The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.
The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>A heavy contact to the opponent 's face</fex> may not merit just a verbal warning
<fex>The company's actions at that stage</fex> were simply preliminary to the takeover.
We are still in the preliminary <fex>phases</fex>.
<fex>His shirt</fex> seems very common compared to their modern fashions.
The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
<fex>Getting a shot against yellow fever</fex> is obligatory for travellers to Benin.
The use of TM software is obligatory <fex>for every freelance translator working on projects for our company</fex>.
<fex>These days</fex>, wearing a seat-belt is mandatory.
Gymnasium is not obligatory <fex>in Sweden</fex>, but nearly everyone attends gymnasium

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Crisp vs Apple Retail Limited UK
